To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 03/06/2024 at 08:11 PM)
Subject:Andy

Message 1914 of 4024
I am happy to pay to ask questions, but I don't think we will like the answers. This is not about you and me trying to figure out anything that we need
to be more constructive and peaceful. This is about reunification. So, I assume Max and I, only now you and I can never talk or be in the same space
again, which may be fine, too. So, no basketball, robotics, Kerri Betts, SAAS emails or conference calls, no anything - period. Everything has to end,
full stop.
"Dr. Benjamin’s job is to help you improve communication between your child and you."
"If an e-mail is sent to the CoParent Psychotherapist and copied to the other parent, do not answer it before the CoParent Psychotherapist is able to
respond, first."
"Once, the treatment phase begins, for each email reviewed, you will be charged $5. Any email requiring a response from Dr. Benjamin will be charge
at $20 per response.
Based on what is stipulated, NO email can be answered w/o him responding. That's $25 a pop.
Your RO is pointless. This whole time I have been working to at least have some modicum of communication so we could do the things like we did
with Dr Brown, Kerri Betts, Basketball and Robotics, and most importantly getting Adrian into SAAS. That all goes away. We do nothing now.
We went from plans of nesting and the Alyssa model to this. Do you really believe this was all my fault? It all rests on me. Even as you said, you are in
total control, doing what you think is best. I tried so hard to extend an olive branch, and you are never ready. You won't make any effort whatsoever,
so now we have to be treated like toddlers and charged $25 an email.
You promised to consider my proposal to just stop and find something neutral to do to build something back. Today you said you would not
consider that any longer. You said today you would make time to discuss before the end of the week. It will be the last time we talk and I have no
reason to believe you will make good on that promise either.
- Yes, it is all your way. It is what you think is best?
- This is really how you wanted this to go for us?
- This is what you think the kids want to see from us?
We will hate each other's fucking guts till the wet sod is laid over our cold dead bodies. Such a waste of 3 decades and 3 kids. I ask you every few days
since you say it is your way or the highway... How is your way going? Still feeling pretty good about your master plan?

I have been trying to finalize the language before I send the parenting plan and we heap cash on the fire for every grammatical tweak we need to go
back in forth in 1k exchanges.

as simple as this too.
You are picking and choosing when to talk. I am documenting the SAAS Hail Mary and our amazing teamwork vs. your refusal to wordsmith in an
attempt to work collaboratively.
You are intentionally, with forethought and malice, forcing an undue legal process and incurring wasteful and unnecessary burden to this process
with no regard to cost at this point.
If you would like to put the same effort into me reviving the SAAS opportunity for this, please let me know. I am all ears and willing to work with
you.

Thanks for making the time.
Yesterday I asked for an opportunity for us to have a meeting of the minds and really talk about how we can stop this daily slide into hate and
destruction. But now we have urgent issues as well—Andy, RO, and the Parenting Plan.
So are we going to work on what happens in the Emergency Room, or are we going to discuss if we need to start wearing a seat belt? I'd prefer that we
put on the seat belt, but we have patients bleeding out in the emergency room.
I hope you will thoughtfully consider the ongoing impact of saying you are "just not ready" to put on the seatbelt. We have created a prison of our
own making and are paying the price. Hint: adding more locks and layers won't help.

Hey-
Here is a cleaned-up version of exactly what we discussed. I will instruct Lisa to add this almost verbatim to the Parenting Plan. She needs to make
more general than "the restrained person."
Then we can 1) send the parenting plan to you to agree on and 2) send suggestions to Annalisa for the updated RO, Then I will sign.

[x] Other restraining orders:
The Restrained Person may not text, email, or telephone the Protected Person EXCEPT as specifically permitted, below:
The Restrained Person may communicate with the Protected Person via Our Family Wizard solely to co-parent the parties’ children and/or to discuss
the management of shared assets.
The Restrained Person may also communicate with the Protected Person via email in communications with third parties to facilitate business
concerning their minor children and/or managing the parties’ shared assets.
The Restrained Person may forward emails from third parties to the Protected Person as “FYI.”  and allow for 1-1 updates and inline responses to
provide context or advance a private 1-1 discussion on the matter. Example: school admission
The Restrained Person may use phone calls via the OFW platform for short-notice, urgent communications, such as notifying for late handoffs or

This week, we have:
- Gotten AD into SAAS after denial.
- Had a breakthrough with Dr Brown
- Kicked off Kids therapy with Kerris Betts
- Finalized the RO we both are happy with
- Agree to the terms of the Parenting Plan
- Have a co-paring dialog started with Andy

Hey!
Good morning! I think we have a few topics. Glad it does not have to be separate emails!
- AD and Dad: I chatted with him earlier this AM. He is playing the new fortnight now so we agreed I would grab him around lunch.
- SAAS: We are good to go. I'll keep you in the loop with any updates I get. I have talked to AD. We will get his charger back on Monday.
- RO: Annalisa keeps sending the version that has "physical violence." Should we update and send it to her instead to stop the confusion?
- Parenting Plan: If I can get this to you and Annalisa today, can you guys formally approve it today so we can knock that out?
- Sonos: I think they should all be down and ready for handoff now. What is going to work best for you so I can keep that moving?
- Andy: As mentioned, I'm all in as you confirmed we would follow the Plan and RO. If you let him know that, we can start today.
Yikes! Six important topics in one exchange. I am extra appreciative of your cooperation and flexibility this week as this is still so hard. But we have are
making progress. Teamwork !
--------------------------- Andy Rules Exercise---------------------------
Just for fun I did the calc on our Andy discussion. It was far simpler than SAAS, but it might be a decent barometer for what his email rules look like
if with a recent, real-world example.
We had
- 3 email exchanges
- 18 OFW exchanges
His Cost
- $ 5 - send one topic email
- $20 - per mandatory reply
Response Rules
- 24 hours for the questions

Conversation Summary
- The cost of having this conversation for 21 exchanges, at $25 per exchange = $525.
- The elapsed time to have this conversation, at 48 hours max per exchange = 42 days.
- This conversation would end on April 19, 2024 if it was done. We are not done yet.
Love to hear your thoughts when you have time so we can keep this moving. I hope we finish strong after the 6 issues in 4 days we were able to nail
with our improved communication!
The proof is in the pudding.
best
- robert

LOCALHOOPS Training Academy
Congratulations! You've Been Invited!
You have been invited to join our LocalHoops Lions League!
Lions League is our in-house league for athletes looking to continue growing their game without the heavy commitments of AAU.
Please check out the video below for some key differences in AAU vs Lions League
The 3 Levels Of LocalHoops
Sent:03/09/2024 at 03:01 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 03/09/2024 at 04:36 PM)
Subject:Re: AAU

Below is some info regarding Lions League details:
Ages
Lions League begins at 4th grade through 9th grade
Advanced 3rd grade athletes are able to sign up WITH DIRECTOR APPROVAL
Dates
Spring Season runs week of March 18th - June 9th
Athletes will have 1 training during the week (Friday's), and 1 game on the weekend (Sundays generally, some potential Saturday's)
Practices
Practices will be Friday evenings between 5-9PM depending your athletes age at Odle Middle School or Tillicum Middle School in Bellevue
The first 2-4 practices will help us identify teams
Each group will have one 1-hour practice per week
Game Play
Games will start Beginning April and will be at Sammamish HS in Bellevue, or another Bellevue Area gym
We will have an End Of Season Tournament with a Champion from each division
Games will be on Sundays between 3-8PM, with possible Saturday gameplay on occasion

Our All Star Weekend will be returning for Spring 2024! We will host events for athletes to participate in as well as an All-Star Game!
Athletes will vote for their teams All-Star players to participate in the All Star Game
We will have a 3pt contest, as well as a skills contest, and 1on1 contest
All Star Weekend will take place in Mid-Late May
Jerseys
Each athlete needs a Lions League Jersey. These are different from practice jerseys or summer league jerseys. If you participated in our Fall/Winter '23-
24 Lions League, you do not need to purchase a jersey if your athletes still fits.
If this is your first season, you will need to purchase a jersey. You can do so on the registration link.
Coaches and Attendance
Coaches may differ week to week, but will have the same crew of coaches for the entirety of the season
Athletes attendance will be critical to their growth during the season. Please do your best to get your athletes to all events

Teams
Teams will be divided up by skill and age
Athletes will be placed with like skill athletes first, age second, and will have the ability to move up or down to ensure they're being challenged
properly
We aim to have 9-11 players max per team
Athletes will play other LocalHoops In-House Teams weekly, with opportunities to play additional Localhoops AAU Teams, as well as outside club
Girls Only Division Available
We will offer a girls only division! Our goal is to provide a platform for girls to grow and develop with each other!
We pride our Lions League on being very competitive and a place for athletes to continue to grow and improve as basketball players and people, to
achieve their goals!
